intro: [WRONG START] Obernna behen subsp. maritima, commonly known as sea buckthorn, is a shrub native to coastal regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its yellow-orange berries, which are rich in vitamins and antioxidants. The plant thrives in saline and sandy soils, making it well adapted to maritime environments. Its leaves are alternate and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal dunes and supporting wildlife.
